title: Jim Davidson ‘cancels gig' moment before he’s due onstage
text:
Jim was due to perform on Sunday in Southport (Picture: Getty Images)

Comedian Jim Davidson has left fuming fans in his wake after ‘cancelling’ a gig in Southport at the last minute.

Fans on Twitter were kicking off after Jim was due to perform his The People Fight Back show at Southport’s Theatre at the Waterfront Floral Hall on Sunday night.

Moments before heading to stage, it was confirmed the performance had been pulled ‘due to unforeseen circumstances’.

Due to greet audiences at 7.30pm, at 6.38pm Southport Theatre announced on its Facebook page the gig was not going ahead.

‘Due to unforeseen circumstances Jim Davidson will not be performing tonight in the Floral Hall Ballroom,’ the post read. ‘Full refunds will be given.’

Insisting the refunds would commence on Monday, the post continued: ‘We are sincerely sorry for the show not going ahead and will be in touch to commence refunds tomorrow morning.’

Advertisement

The theatre added in the comments: ‘Unfortunately, on Sunday night the Jim Davidson event was cancelled at very short notice.

Jim is yet to speak out (Picture: Rex Features)

‘This is something that was completely out of our control and we can only apologise for this massive inconvenience.’

According to Daily Star, ‘theatre bosses allegedly banned him from entering the building’.

A representative of Southport Theatre told Metro.co.uk: ‘We can only say that that it was out of our control. The venue was not responsible for the decision.

‘However, we were very sorry for any inconvenience it caused our audience and we thanks them for their understanding.’

Reacting to the last-minute cancellation, punters took to social media to sound off on the controversy.

The people fight back, indeed.

One claimed on Twitter: ‘Went to see Jim Davidson last night but because they put him in a smaller room he decided to walk away and left all the people who bought tickets to see his show very angry as some came from far away and booked hotel it just not fair.’

Another called the comedian a ‘disgrace’ as they wrote: ‘Jim Davidson cancelled his show tonight in Southport. Arrived at the venue kicked off at staff swearing and shouting refused to perform, 500 people with no show to watch, travel and hotel costs which are not refundable bloke is a disgrace!’

Jim has threatened to not turn up to shows before (Picture: Rex Features)

One angry fan replied to the theatre on Facebook: ‘Disgrace, from what we got told it’s not an illness or accident which would be forgiven.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Exact words from the lady at floral hall “Our staff will not allow him back in here”, what does that say!!

‘Day off work booked, hotel booked, meal booked, car parking booked. For an event to be cancelled 20 mins before he’s due on. Absolute disgrace. Jim Davidson explain yourself????’

Earlier this year the comedian threatened to skip out of a gig in Dundee, after he turned up to the theatre and didn’t see any advertising for his show.

‘Just arrived at the whitehall theatre in Dundee. Not a poster in sight no fliers and a A frame outside adverising another show. Of 45 gigs sold out this one of the 3 that didn’t. I am back at the hotel. Why should I bother.? No wonder it went skint a few years back, [sic]’ he wrote in May.

In 2017 the comedian cancelled a gig in Exeter 30 minutes before he was due on stage, with the comedian slamming management.

‘Deep apologies to the poor people who were expecting to see me at the corn exchange tonight […] We were contracted to get in and sound check at 5. They let us in at 6 30. We could have fixed the sound system perhaps. But not at 6 30. And to be told “you are welcome to come back when its fixed” the lad doing the sound said “our propper speakers have blown up”, [sic]’ he wrote.

Advertisement

‘Worse thing? The attitude of the two persons running the place and the bulls**t that they come out with when they clearly know it is their fault. They will now be planning ways to blame me.

‘I did nt argue with them as i could be accused of saying anything!!! These women plainly showed they did not want me there. I don’t know what else to say except sorry and shame on them. [sic].’

Metro.co.uk has made numerous attempts to contact Jim’s reps for comment.
